meanings.definition: Capable of being educated or taught.
meanings.sent1: The young minds were educible and eager to learn new things.
meanings.sent2: She found the educible students in her class to be the most rewarding to teach.
meanings.sent3: The educible puppy quickly learned to sit and fetch, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her educible nature was like a blank canvas waiting to be painted with knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The educible nature of the soil made it perfect for planting a variety of crops.

meanings.definition: Able to be learned or understood.
meanings.sent1: The educible concept was grasped easily by the students.
meanings.sent2: The educible language was picked up by the child in no time.
meanings.sent3: The educible puzzle was quickly solved by the clever detective.
meanings.sent4: Her educible mind absorbed new information like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The educible nature of the game made it enjoyable for players of all ages.

meanings.definition: Susceptible to being influenced or shaped by education.
meanings.sent1: The educible child was greatly impacted by the positive role models around them.
meanings.sent2: Her educible personality made her open to new ideas and perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The educible student's mind was like a garden ready to bloom with knowledge.
meanings.sent4: His educible nature allowed him to adapt easily to different teaching styles.
meanings.sent5: The educible nature of the culture made it rich with traditions and customs.
